intent: Inform about recent seismic activity and its relation to volcanic eruptions in Hawaii.
data: Sixth eruption within the Kilauea caldera since 2020
claims: A magnitude 4.3 earthquake occurred near Pahala, Hawaii.
The earthquake triggered a series of four aftershocks.
The quakes have not impacted Kilauea or Mauna Loa.
Deep seismic activity has been ongoing in the region since 2019.
Kilauea has been erupting continuously since 1983.
topic: Earthquakes and volcanic activity in Hawaii
